content.question: For time <math alttext="t greater than or equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>â‰¥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></math>, a particle moves along a straight line with velocity <math alttext="v of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> meters per second. The graph of <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown. Of the following, which is the best estimate for the total distance, in meters, traveled by the particle from time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></math> to <math alttext="t equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></math> seconds?
